website_summaries.verdict: From a reputable manufacturer, this rugged, well-made thermometer is the all-around best.
cons: Range is high, but thermometer does not read above 1,200°F

customer_reviews.title: You're kidding right?
customer_reviews.text: Package stapled together. Obviously opened before. Dead on arrival Tried include battery. Tried two new batteries. Tested all batteries used. All batteries full charge. Pressed every button on the unit. Held down every button on the unit. Tried holding multiple buttons down... you know what would help... if the Chinese actually incuded instructions!!! ABSOLUTELY NO INSTRUCTIONS ON HOW TO USE. PATHETIC DEAD ITEM. ARE YOU KIDDING ME? WHERE ARE THE INSTRUCTIONS? WHY ARE YOU SHIPING OUT DEAD ITEMS!!!!!! ALSO, BASED UPON ALL THE OTHER ONE STAR REVIEWS, IT APPEARS THEY STAPLED A NON-FUNCTIONAL UNIT AND PUT IT RIGHT BACK ON THE SHELF, SELLING IT TO ME.
customer_reviews.author: AmazonJohn

customer_reviews.title: You need to know exactly what you're buying before you make the sale. Add a plus get another beam
customer_reviews.text: beware! 62max and 62max+. If you want the 2 laser beams, make sure you don't just get the 62max, very deceptive! You can watch videos labeled 62max and the double lasers will be there. When I got my 62max I was kinda shocked, wondering where the 2 beams were.
customer_reviews.author: Carl

customer_reviews.title: DOA
customer_reviews.text: Just arrived and...DOES NOT WORK! Oh, when I pull the trigger the device measures the temperature (in Centigrade, unfortunately). But the SET and SEL buttons that are supposed to let me change parameters (like toggling from centigrade to fahrenheit, etc) do not work. I'm 73, so I can remember a time when Fluke made absolutely outstanding, bullet proof, top of the food chain products. Alas, no more. Another once great company has apparently bitten the dust.
customer_reviews.author: Beach Guy

customer_reviews.title: Won't last very long not worth the extra $$$
customer_reviews.text: I bought the infrared thermometer to use to determine the temperature in my outdoor wood fired pizza oven. It seemed to work fine for a while then stopped working even after a battery change. Unfortunately it was just out of warranty. I expected a better quality unit from Fluke. I'm sure I only used it maybe two dozen times. Seemed convenient and easy to use but I don't think spending the extra money is worth it. (62 Max+)
customer_reviews.author: VS

customer_reviews.title: Not effective for measurement of human temperatures
customer_reviews.text: Have tried to use this device for the measurement of human temperature i.e. does he/she have a fever to no avail. Fluke has been my go-to brand for many measurement devices but this one has failed the grade. Have changed emmisivity settings to try to calibrate it. If someone knows how to set this device up to measure human temperatures, please advise.
customer_reviews.author: Peter314

customer_reviews.title: Tougher than most
customer_reviews.text: I tried several of these thermometers in the $30-$150 range before settling on the Fluke and I honestly didn't find any real differences in accuracy between any of them. I chose to keep the Fluke due to the drop, dirt & moisture resistance of it's casing and the reliability of the Fluke meters that I currently own. For occasional household use however, I don't think it's necessary to spend this much.
customer_reviews.author: A. Cowart

customer_reviews.title: I can prove to myself that I do NOT have a fever.
customer_reviews.text: What a fluke that I bought this Fluke just before the pandemic. I'd intended to use it for cooking, other hobbies, and for finding hot & cold spots on appliances & in my walls. It does all of these things very well. The 1 unawarded star is my wish for a slightly wider display screen. That would make numbers near the edges easier to see from slight angles. Anyway, during stay-at-home, when hypochondria hits, I quickly take a reading of my forehead to prove to myself that I DO NOT have a fever.
customer_reviews.author: OLdweeb

customer_reviews.title: DEAD ON ARRIVAL
customer_reviews.text: I didn't work. I bought batteries for it and it still didn't work. I returned it for replacement. Amazon's locker replacement is very good. it would be helpful if Amazon in their software description would describe the locker process. LOCKERS AT THE SITE ---- NO HELP AT THE SITE WITH YOUR PACKAGE --- BEST TO USE THE PACKIGE IT CAME IN --- HAVE YOUR RETURN PACKAGE SEALED AND LABELED --- ENTER YOUR CODE AND THE LOCKER DOOR WILL OPEN --- PUT THE PACKAGE IN --- CLOSE THE DOOR
customer_reviews.author: Jim

customer_reviews.title: A must have tool for HVAC-R
customer_reviews.text: Knowing the temperature of specific components is crucial when diagnosing or troubleshooting HVAC/R issues. Don't guess, don't BS the customer, get the data and know what to do with it and what it means for the system. If you take care of this Fluke equipment you will have for your entire career (unless it grows legs and walks). Spend the extra money up front and get quality that will last. Even though this is rubberized and protected, treat is respectfully and periodically check its calibration. Any kind of test instrument like meters, refrigerant scales, thermometers need to be checked and re calibrated periodically. If you rely on these test instruments, shouldn't you be sure that you are getting accurate numbers?
customer_reviews.author: Oryx

customer_reviews.title: Best in class, cheaper ones have fixed emissivity
customer_reviews.text: Because fixed emissivity was a deal breaker for me, anything cheaper than this was really not an option. It's an amazing product though and well worth the $100. It's accurate, easy to use, and rugged but still compact and comfortable to hold. *To lock a reading for longer than 5 seconds after releasing the trigger just hold the up or down arrow. You can also press SEL to cycle through the modes and see Max, Min, Avg, and Diff for the same reading. Each button press resets the 5 second sleep countdown.
customer_reviews.author: Lloyd

customer_reviews.title: This is a great IR Thermometer
customer_reviews.text: I really like this IR thermometer. I had the previous version for quite some time and really liked using it. The new version, 62 Max, is awesome and has a backlight display which works great in low light conditions. The head of this unit larger than the previous version but once I started using it there were no issues with it. It a little disappointing that Fluke doesn't provide a case with this considering the cost of the IR therm but I was able to find one on amazon that fits quite well and protects adequately. The only reason that I gave this four stars was do to the omission of a case.
customer_reviews.author: Brian

customer_reviews.title: Not the right meter
customer_reviews.text: This is an excellent meter for industrial use, We had intended it for medical use and it does not work for that purpose. Super easy to use, it gives a lot of information.
customer_reviews.author: Paul Stone

customer_reviews.title: Works nicely but directions are crap
customer_reviews.text: The directions are similar to an Ikea product ... lots of pictographs but few words. That is mostly a problem for how to configure the emissivity setting on the thermometer. No instructions whatsoever. I had to refer to other instruction manuals on the Fluke website to understand the emissivity setting and how to configure. The instructions included had a date of 2012 ... they have been using this worthless instruction manual for a long time. I expected much more from a company such as Fluke.
customer_reviews.author: William L. Aldrich

customer_reviews.title: Fluke worth it?
customer_reviews.text: YEP! HVAC work. This is my 5th IR Thermo of different brands over the years and it's amazingly accurate. I use my K to check it's accuracy and it's always within 1-1.7F at any distance and emissivity. Not sure what makes it so accurate but for sure the other brands I've owned didn't have it.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Very useful tool
customer_reviews.text: I use this to check the temperature on the gearbox of my mower, the engine temp to see if the temp gauge is working, soil temperature, and anything else I need to know. If you haven't used one, you'll find a lot of uses for it. I use it to check the oven temperature and to measure the heat of candy in the saucepan. It can tell me the soil temperature in the spring, so I know when we should be planting the garden. Fluke makes pretty good instruments, in my limited experience with them.
customer_reviews.author: Dennis L. Allen

customer_reviews.title: Complicated and Counterintuitive
customer_reviews.text: Let me start by saying I am a HUGE fan of Fluke. I have several of their meters, which I use daily and recommend often. I have never had a problem with any of my Fluke meters. This item however did not work for me. It was good quality, and I'm sure it works very well for its intended use, but all I needed was a simple IR thermometer, and this one was just too complicated and counterintuitive. I ended up buying a Klein which does exactly what I needed it to do and nothing else.
customer_reviews.author: Don Zappone

customer_reviews.title: Don't leave it in your wife's kitchen, or you'll have to buy another one.
customer_reviews.text: I made the mistake of leaving this in the kitchen for a couple years (it's great for telling that your grilled cheese pan is 375 degrees, or your can of soup hit the perfect temperature), and then I took it on a road trip to pick up a new car (wonderful to see if brakes are dragging, etc) After getting the evil eye for taking it along, I decided to buy another one to avoid the wrath of estrogen I sensed coming my way on the next trip.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon customer

customer_reviews.title: Great tool for the kitchen
customer_reviews.text: I use this device to determine the temperature of my cast iron pans when I use them for searing meats. It works instantly and seems to be accurate. Also it is great fun to amaze my guests by grabbing a futuristic-looking device and pointing it at the pan on my stove.
customer_reviews.author: Richard P. Green II

customer_reviews.title: How do you turn on the red laser guidance beam. If there is one....
customer_reviews.text: I assumed based on the ad photos and description that the the 62 Max would have a red infra red pinpoint laser to mark the actual temperature reading location. Unfortunately the pinpoint laser on my unit is defect or maybe there is a secret way to turn it on???? Unless you only measure a point very close to the unit, it is not practical to use the unit without laser guidance. Anybody have any idea how to turn on the red laser beam ???
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: I just trust the readings from Fluke instruments!!!
customer_reviews.text: This device makes me fell "professional" Its durable and great to use. When I visit facilities' Engineering staff and they notice I have a Fluke product, my credibility instantly jumps and I get comments from engineers. They all know the value of the brand as well as the person who selects the instrument. Question: is it worth the money? Hell-yah! Boys have their "toys" and Pros have their Flukes!
customer_reviews.author: Masterep

customer_reviews.title: 62 Max or 62 Maxplus...Save your money
customer_reviews.text: 62Max is excellent. Fast read outs. Accuracy is very. CLose to my Etekcity 630. Very well made. Screen is very nice and setup a breeze. Glad I didn’t go for the 62Max plus. 10:1 ratio is more than adequate and not much of a shortfall over 12:1 ratio. My Etek 630 is 16:1 and the readings at the same distance,near and far are extremely close and sometimes the same. Nice grip too. An excellent choice!
customer_reviews.author: Family Man

customer_reviews.title: Defective and inpoerable
customer_reviews.text: The red aiming laser did not work. I looked closely and could see the unit had previously been disassembled. The seller sold me a USED and DEFECTIVE item.
customer_reviews.author: Dogbert

customer_reviews.title: Worth the money
customer_reviews.text: Really like this tool. It has a quality build, and is feature packed for the intermediate user. Accuracy seems on par from what you would expect from an uncertified fluke product, very close. If you need to split hairs with accuracy, step up to the certified version.(at extra cost) I would recommend spending the few extra bucks, and buying this instrument over the "bargain/cheap" offerings out there. Don't think the average user, who demands reasonable accuracy, will be disappointed with this tool.
customer_reviews.author: Bill

customer_reviews.title: Works exactly as described.
customer_reviews.text: Very accurate temperature measurement. Easy to use and well designed. Uses easily replaced batteries that have a long life. It is water and drop resistant. This is a good tool to have if you need to check or measure temperature. I am very pleased with the performance. The Fluke reputation is alive and well.
customer_reviews.author: Robert J. Murry

customer_reviews.title: Great for constantly measuring the same item but not too usefull if you are measuring various items or points of different refle
customer_reviews.text: The item is accurate in temperature measurement however, there is a requirement to tune the EPS constantly to allow for the material that you are measuring against. This would be fine if you are always measuring the same item however the variability in measurement as you cross between material types (reflectivity) means that the usefulness is limited. It would be nice if Fluke added a test to measure the reflectivity of the item under measurement and then self tuned the temperature measurement.
customer_reviews.author: Keith

customer_reviews.title: This is the one
customer_reviews.text: You want it, you need it more than you know. Just get it and cherish it. Use it for all kinds of things. Sync your thermostat in the house to be more accurate. Figure out exactly what temp that burner on the stove is for when you make those awesome scrambled eggs! or Is one of those cylinders on your engine getting hot? You won't know if you don't check and you can't check it right without one of these. Have fun! It works goodly!
customer_reviews.author: John French

customer_reviews.title: Not made in America and Awkward Instructions
customer_reviews.text: Poor instructions. Functionality of the unit is in picture form. Takes quite a bit of trial and error to delve out what a given (most) pictures are trying to convey. Best I know Fluke is pretty good stuff. They really should put a few more dollars in the instruction guide. Then again, it seems fairly obvious that there may be a translation problem. Be forewarned.
customer_reviews.author: True Review

customer_reviews.title: seems to work well
customer_reviews.text: I have only used this a few times but it seems to work well. I measured the temperature of an exhaust manifold up to 970 degrees F and also cooler objects down to 60 degrees. All readings seemed to be accurate. Seems to be fairly well constructed although not indestructable.
customer_reviews.author: Nels

customer_reviews.title: Came without certification
customer_reviews.text: I ordered this with certification, the one that arrived was not certified. The previous one only had 2 months left of 1 year certification. Stay away
customer_reviews.author: Stephen W Gale

customer_reviews.title: rendering it useless for evaluating refrigerated or room temperatures
customer_reviews.text: Fluke instruments are well-made, and we have purchased many. The problem with this one is that while they claim that the range is -30C to 500C, the NIST calibration (which is why we bought it) only covers 30C to 450C, rendering it useless for evaluating refrigerated or room temperatures.
customer_reviews.author: Seran B.

customer_reviews.title: Also useful for pinpointing 'hot spots' in breaker boxes that may ...
customer_reviews.text: If you tow a boat, RV--anything towed--an infrared thermometer is a must-carry item, especially when using surge brakes. I had no idea mine were sticking due to an aging master cylinder and with the Fluke, I was able to tell that the brake rotors were heating up way beyond spec's. Damaged or contaminated wheel bearings will exhibit similar signs. Also useful for pinpointing 'hot spots' in breaker boxes that may indicate faulty or overloaded wiring or breakers. An IR thermometer is cheap insurance considering the cost of a bent or broken axle, fire or worse. Fluke is at or near industrial grade so spend a few dollars more--don't buy a knock off!
customer_reviews.author: Michael Hagan

customer_reviews.title: Excellent, professional quality thermometer
customer_reviews.text: Very easy to use yet full featured. The two dual laser beam make it very clear how large the measuring zone it. Measuring range is large, up to 600C. Sturdy body, gaskets all around so it is waterproof. Reproducible measurements. I use it for everything from soldering process temp measurements to sugar syrup cooking. Only good things to say.
customer_reviews.author: CuriousMarc

customer_reviews.title: Quality Control
customer_reviews.text: There is a small piece of debris stuck between the clear face piece and the digital display. It doesn't block the display but it is annoying as it jumps around due to static. Will probably return this one for an exchange.
customer_reviews.author: PhoebeG

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for Home Inspection
customer_reviews.text: I have a need for a product like this for everyday work. I recently bought a $300 dollar one thinking it would be the last one I ever need. After 6 months, the old product broke. Luckily the company refunded my money and I bought this Fluke. I liked the idea of the "drop" rating of the product. Is is fairly small, with a lanyard attachment so can easily store in my toolbelt with no special cases or anything else. Simple operation and all you need for temperature (it has an easy way to see temperature differential also). Update: After a couple of months - still perfect - dropped several time - still going strong.
customer_reviews.author: Texas Greatness

customer_reviews.title: Excellent top quality Fluke product
customer_reviews.text: Excellent top quality Fluke product. A bit pricey, but it's a Fluke. Mainly I got this because of the narrow area of detection, dual lasers that show you the circle it's detecting, temp max-min-average & difference betwixt high and low. Back light is just fine however, I wish it was adjustable for timeout. Runs on only ONE AA cell (awesome). Like many other reviewers stated, the manual is awful, pictographs only. I still don't know what the "trigger" setting is. Highly recommended.
customer_reviews.author: Atheous

customer_reviews.title: Have only had this short time but am happy with it so far
customer_reviews.text: Have only had this a short time but am happy with it so far. Like others, I would have preferred actual written instructions to go with the graphics. You can't go wrong with just "punching" your way around though. You wont cause any irreparable damage to the unit, not that you can damage it from just punching buttons. Not having a master calibration device I will have to trust that the unit is accurate. Not using it in any professional capacity, so what the hey ! I Bought Fluke based on their perceived reputation as titans in the electronic measuring instruments industry.
customer_reviews.author: Gweedo Murray

customer_reviews.title: Fluke 62 Max+
customer_reviews.text: With a product being this sensitive, I believe it should have came with a case when purchased.
customer_reviews.author: glen lalchan

customer_reviews.title: Reasonable product with a useless manual
customer_reviews.text: Given the pricing it is a reasonable product with an embarrassingly useless manual. No useful text, just those silly little diagrams like IKEA products. If you don't know what EMS is you won't get an explanation for this adjustable feature unless you hunt around on-line. The Min - max- average-differential function only works in scan mode; no memory in hold mode. I wanted to compare two engines side by side on a boat, looking for differences between the two in order to uncover early problems. This unit will not let you take two discrete readings and compare the difference.
customer_reviews.author: Larry

customer_reviews.title: God tool
customer_reviews.text: I use this thermometer to find sore spots or injuries on our horses. The sore mussels or injured areas produce heat. This Thermometer is able to help us to find the injuries. My wife and I are both Farriers and our Daughter train's horses for a living. I was not sure if it was going to work when I purchased it. It did. I also use this thermometer in helping to work on our vehicles and tractors. I love it. It is heavy duty and has held up to my uses.
customer_reviews.author: Sean

customer_reviews.title: Great Thermometer,Great for HVAC and REFRIGERATION.
customer_reviews.text: Nice meter,bad instructions book written by a chinese child in drawings.I highly recommend the meter if your smart enough to read illustrations in the owners guide of how to set the thermometer.Good Price too I paid $95.00.
customer_reviews.author: Dayton From Ft Myers

customer_reviews.title: Good unit, instructions/info a bit lacking
customer_reviews.text: Works well. 32.4 degrees on a glass of crushed ice water. Worth having the NIST certificate for peace of mind on accuracy, however I wish they would’ve included an emissivity table for various substances, like copper, aluminum, etc.
customer_reviews.author: August

customer_reviews.title: Great product
customer_reviews.text: Just what was ordered. Arrived on time with current calibration sheet.
customer_reviews.author: Kenneth Stanfield

customer_reviews.title: dont buy this item
customer_reviews.text: I have never gotten mine to work. dont know what to do, just wasted 99 dollars.
customer_reviews.author: bruce w.

customer_reviews.title: It's a Fluke...
customer_reviews.text: Yes! A very well conceived and executed instrument as I grew used to expect from Fluke over the years. A pleasure to use it every time, thanks to its features, reliability and accuracy. Just make sure you don't install a cheap alkaline battery in it and leave it there for extended time to ruin your investment.
customer_reviews.author: mikyd

customer_reviews.title: I can readily find any cold spots or uninsulated areas!
customer_reviews.text: Durable and easily usable. I can readily find any cold spots or uninsulated areas within my house or when inspecting others' houses! Due to this being the MAX model, the device readily works within the outdoor areas of the northern climates. Most would ask why they would want to use an infrared thermometer every other day, but if you own a house, you know you're always looking for cold (or hot) spots! Since I'm a little more zealous about accuracy due to making sure I'm providing rational solutions, I spent a few more dollars for this industrial, including getting the MAX model!
customer_reviews.author: Roger

customer_reviews.title: Simple to use
customer_reviews.text: I do love this tool. I bought for my use with classic car hoses. But this also works great at work for when you have AC issues. Aim directly at vent for temperature readings. Best ever tool!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: I tested this meter with in piping thermometers, pin ...
customer_reviews.text: I tested this meter with in piping thermometers, pin gauges and strap on gauges. This unit is extremely accurate hence the reputation (and price) of all Fluke equipment. I use this meter to gauge all other meters. Anyone in the trades will agree that to be on top of your game you have to invest in quality equipment. This meter is a must have if you are a +5 yr mechanic in the hvac business.
customer_reviews.author: Boilertech

customer_reviews.title: Basic Meter, Works Great
customer_reviews.text: This works very well. The manual stinks; we're not effing idiots. It works in the kitchen, it works in the garage, it works on the air conditioner. It works. There are a few settings, but overall it does one thing, gives you the temp of the surface between the red dots. It ain't rocket science. The carabiner they supply with it is crap and will fail in the first couple of uses. If you want a carabiner to hang it from, get something from Black Diamond, EK, Mad Rock, or some other climbing company.
customer_reviews.author: Art Van Hecke

customer_reviews.title: Fluke equals Top quality products
customer_reviews.text: You can never go wrong with Fluke products. This unit performs exactly as described and is very sturdy and durable. There are many other meters out there. But none compare to the quality and accuracy of this Fluke Meter.
customer_reviews.author: MAD MAX

customer_reviews.title: It is swesome for teo important reasons: 1. ...
customer_reviews.text: It is swesome for teo important reasons: 1. It measures temp precisely 2. My cat loves playing eith its red dots. The second one is most important :-)
customer_reviews.author: Manuk

customer_reviews.title: Cool -- laser is the best
customer_reviews.text: Really cool. Love the laser, worth the extra $$ for it! Great for checking the temp coming from my AC vents! Super durable, similar to finish on a power drill. Default is Celsius.. had to change to Fahrenheit for the good old US of A.
customer_reviews.author: Keith Rogers

customer_reviews.title: and the buttons are pretty self explanatory after a few minutes of use
customer_reviews.text: BROKEN AFTER THREE AND A HALF YEARS. UPDATE: Sept 11, 2018: The unit stopped working just outside of warranty, and Fluke said they'd replace it for... $86. I am not very impressed with the unit after several years of use. The trigger seemed to work sometimes, and not others. It was an ok purchase, but I would suggest buying multiple cheaper units rather than this much more expensive one. It didn't really last that long overall.
customer_reviews.author: Krimes

customer_reviews.title: Excellent
customer_reviews.text: I'm an HVAC contractor. I measure temperatures, pressures, voltages, amp draws, and other values constantly during a normal business day. This thermometer is an excellent tool at a good price. The manual is terrible, but it's easy to toggle through the selections and set up this instrument. It is very accurate. Accurate enough that I can avoid most contact type measurements and troubleshoot hot and cold spots easily. This is NOT a cheap, non contact thermometer, but it is well worth the extra dollars to get a device that measures like those priced much higher.
customer_reviews.author: aldematt

customer_reviews.title: Accurate for the price.
customer_reviews.text: I use this meter for testing ground temperature before walking our dogs and for checking our air conditioning vents to make sure we are getting cold air at the right temperature. I have had the meter for several months and it seems to be pretty accurate.
customer_reviews.author: Don

customer_reviews.title: Typical Fluke (quality+++)
customer_reviews.text: Five years later and never a problem. I have other Fluke products and can say the same thing. Sure all of the brands are sourced from China but specs, oversight, and QC are NOT the same from brand to brand. You can't go wrong with Fluke.
customer_reviews.author: Jeff Jones

customer_reviews.title: Good product
customer_reviews.text: I've always wanted one of these and found it on sale on Amazon I don't regret my purchase and would recommend
customer_reviews.author: R. Ashby

customer_reviews.title: Another awesome Fluke product
customer_reviews.text: All I can say is great product. Works as expected, not complicated, and reliable. Can't go wrong with Fluke tools.
customer_reviews.author: Jonny Appleseed

customer_reviews.title: Very high quality unit.
customer_reviews.text: I always like to buy the good stuff. It has been my experience they last longer, are more accurate, and simply you get what you pay for. One great thing about this unit is you can set it's reflectivity index for maximum accuracy... but that means you have to download an index somewhere online. Or simply use the default setting which provides reasonable accuracy. If I bought one again, I think I would opt for the dual laser pointer version as that feature provides the "cone" of measurement.
customer_reviews.author: aw

customer_reviews.title: Great way of controlling temperature readings.
customer_reviews.text: Nice product for checking food temperatures in kitchen areas. Nice product, easy to use, safely way of temperature control measurements. Fluke makes great meter products, recommend this product in home or in Professional kitchens.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Not great.
customer_reviews.text: Battery cover has sharp edge all the way around, making it uncomfortable to hold. And the Fahrenheit tolerance isn't shown in the product info here on Amazon, but it's +_ 3 degrees F for the 62 MAX and +_ 2 degrees F for the 62 MAX+. People who live in a Fahrenheit world may not understand how large a Celsius degree is. The wide tolerance makes this unit less useful for checking thermostat calibration.
customer_reviews.author: Toolhead

customer_reviews.title: Defective
customer_reviews.text: I gave this as a gift and it didn't work. Very embarrassing.
customer_reviews.author: vioclerk

customer_reviews.title: awesome product
customer_reviews.text: Great product, worth every penny, very accurate temperature readings. I use it for checking bearing temperatures on conveyors. Helps alot to find out which ones are about to fail so we can replace them without causing downtime on our equipment. Nice and compact design, easy to slip into my back pocket when climbing ladders.
customer_reviews.author: Tim

customer_reviews.title: Fluke still makes high quality products, YAY!
customer_reviews.text: Fluke still makes high quality products, YAY! I really like this one. I've had it about a year now. When shopping for an IR Thermometer, watch out for cheap ones if you need to measure high temperatures. There are basically 2 ranges available. The cheap ones historically didn't measure above about 700F. There seem to be a lot of new cheap ones lately that claim to have the higher range, but I would be careful in choosing.
customer_reviews.author: Engineer

customer_reviews.title: Fluke still the best in measuring equipment
customer_reviews.text: Accurate rugged and easy to use, is drop impact rated and water proof no more broken pyrometer well worth it's weight in gold. Fluke still the best money can by. Auto Mechanic who is skilled at dropping things approved (clumsy) this pyrometer has survived being dropped in water, coolant and falling off tool boxes with impact guns falling on top of it. The last pyrometer you'll ever have to buy
customer_reviews.author: Joseph Figueroa

customer_reviews.title: High quality product, but low quality manual.
customer_reviews.text: Works great, feels very substantial and appears to be made from good quality materials. I have to agree with other reviews I have seen and say the pictograph style instructions are horrible and the company really needs to step up and provide some written instructions.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great value and reliable accuracy in an IR Themometer
customer_reviews.text: I bought this IR thermometer to use in the kitchen to verify the cooking temperature of our oven and range top burner settings. It works perfectly and it's accuracy is spot on and guaranteed by the Fluke Corporation who is an industry leader in portable measurement technologies. This device also works to check that your refrigerator and freezer settings are correct to premature prevent spoilage. Almost no other manufacture gives complete specifications on their IR thermometers or guarantees their accuracy. Fluke products are my first choice for precision measurements and are always reliable.
customer_reviews.author: G.S.

customer_reviews.title: great tool
customer_reviews.text: On the farm I use this to diagnose bad bearings and hydraulic restrictions.
customer_reviews.author: Nurse

customer_reviews.title: The instructions are horrible.
customer_reviews.text: The instructions are horrible. There are no words, just pictures.
customer_reviews.author: Insufficient Funds

customer_reviews.title: An Essential tool
customer_reviews.text: IR thermometers are essential in my line of work. It doesn't get more accurate than a fluke. I wanted an IR thermometer that wasn't huge and this didn't disappoint. It can easily fit in a side pocket of work pants.
customer_reviews.author: Jonathan

customer_reviews.title: This is the perfect item: wide temp range and accurate
customer_reviews.text: I use this on my wood stove. This thing is wicked accurate (we have another unit with a wider range of temperatures and compared). It even came with the battery required. Point and shoot. And I feel safer now. Very pleased with this purchase. By the way, you can't find this range of temperatures in your Lowes; I know because we tried. You will want this unit for your wood stove given the top temp it can cover.
customer_reviews.author: Posting some thoughts

customer_reviews.title: Great tool for coating engineers
customer_reviews.text: Works well for quick temperature measurements. Use it all the time to check powder coated parts exiting oven. Very dependable and instantaneous. Must have tool for a coating engineer. Like others, I agree manual is worthless and I have concluded on my own that I am measuring the temperature between the dots....at one foot that's about a 1" diameter
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Perfect
customer_reviews.text: Accurate, durable, uses only 1 AA battery and lasts quite a while on it, has the dual lasers that rotate like magic depending on distance, has adjustable emissivity, and is quite handy for a lot of things. Is it worth the extra money? If you're going to be using it regularly, owning it for a long time, and/or need the accuracy then yes, absolutely. Quality x time = lifelong satisfaction. Poor quality x time = lifelong regret.
customer_reviews.author: TC

customer_reviews.title: Spotting
customer_reviews.text: Works great and gives accurate temp readings. After a 5 months I did notice a couple of dark green spots on the yellow handle portion as if someone put the tip of an ink pen to it. Not sure what it's from, maybe mold? This doesn't effect the functionality of the unit but I'd be curious if anyone else has experienced this spotting issue.
customer_reviews.author: Albert

customer_reviews.title: Yellow Bird is the Best
customer_reviews.text: Fluke makes a great product and when I was done with the comparisions I found that I liked this one the best because it had better accuracy, overall range of degrees that can be read and the operating range of the instrument was very wide as well. It has a laser pointer, simple menu and switch operation and works well. Backed up by the Fluke reputaton and you have a great product. Well worth the money! Buy only one and you'll safe it in the long run.
customer_reviews.author: Walk and Talk Traveler

customer_reviews.title: High Quality
customer_reviews.text: Fluke makes high quality professional line products. I have wanted one for years and finally had a reason to buy the certified calibrated version. Works well and easy to set up and use.
customer_reviews.author: Bobby R Carter Jr

customer_reviews.title: No more guessing!
customer_reviews.text: This device works great, can be used even when you are at a distance, and appears to be fairly accurate. I even use it for checking the water temperature for yeast when making fresh bread. No more guessing!
customer_reviews.author: Kenneth B. Paton

customer_reviews.title: Contact-free temperature measurements
customer_reviews.text: Good non-contact temperature measurements. Appears to be accurate Lives up to the Fluke standard.
customer_reviews.author: PK

customer_reviews.title: Read the manual. We'll worth the time.
customer_reviews.text: I love Fluke. Excellent products. I use to scan wheel bearing /hub temp On pull trailer.
customer_reviews.author: John

customer_reviews.title: fluctuates temps
customer_reviews.text: Fluctuating temperatures does not seem accurate. I would like to return..
customer_reviews.author: VH

customer_reviews.title: it became apparent quickly this one is better made. It's built solidly
customer_reviews.text: I have owned the Extech version, but after two years the buttons started to wear out. I bought a cheap one from Harbor Freight, but it felt flimsy. Taking this Fluke out of the box, it became apparent quickly this one is better made. It's built solidly, and I don't feel like it would break if I were to drop it. This one is well worth the money.
customer_reviews.author: IM Home Inspections

customer_reviews.title: Works fine.
customer_reviews.text: Works fine. Just would have been nice if it came with a case.
customer_reviews.author: Benjamin Graham

customer_reviews.title: fluke good instructions bad
customer_reviews.text: the fluke 62 max plus was every thing the description stated the only reason i gave 3 stares instead of 4 was the very poor instruction that came with thermometer I still dont know what all the buttons do. I did check the tempature of the 62 against a certefied control themometer it was spot on. A little on the pricy side but very well built feels good in your hand
customer_reviews.author: wayne

customer_reviews.title: Overkill!
customer_reviews.text: This thermometer is way overkill for the light duty kitchen work that I use it for but Fluke is definitely a trusted brand for me and I really like this thermometer. I might not be using it to measure the melting point of various space-age materials but it's nice to know that it can tell me exactly how hot my boiling pot of oil is so I can make tasty french fries. Thanks Fluke!
customer_reviews.author: Marshall

customer_reviews.title: WORKS ONLY ON DARK SURFACES AND STILL NOT ACCURATE
customer_reviews.text: Save your money, simply doesn't work except in unique industrial applications but I question even that. The surface must be dark that you are measuring.
customer_reviews.author: RRS

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: This works great. It's actually kind of fun to have around the house. We're checking the temp on everything!
customer_reviews.author: Mike Schuppan

customer_reviews.title: Good product 👍
customer_reviews.text: I went for quality on this rather than buy the cheaper ones out there, no regrets, fluke makes good products and this one is no exception. Will be using it for years to come
customer_reviews.author: Dan

customer_reviews.title: Great for temp reads on cylinders for motors
customer_reviews.text: Bought this for my husband for Christmas. He lost one that was old and was lost without it. He used it for checking cylinder temps in motorcycles and snowmobiles. He loves this. He says it is much better than the one he used to have. Loves it.
customer_reviews.author: Kristene

customer_reviews.title: High quality product.
customer_reviews.text: High quality products across the board. This is no exception. Ultra sensitive and works very well and very accurately. Although I am in the construction trades, I primarily use it for cooking.
customer_reviews.author: Irad

customer_reviews.title: Works very well.
customer_reviews.text: This particular model "paints" two laser dots and assumingly takes the average temperature between the two dots. The dots are further apart the more distant you are from the object being measured. Personally, I think the single-laser style is more user friendly.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Works Extremely Well - Very Easy to Use
customer_reviews.text: Out of the box, the unit works as it should. Very easy to use and programmable for various surfaces. Impressed with the range it will function within.
customer_reviews.author: Lee R

customer_reviews.title: Excellent unit
customer_reviews.text: A great unit for quick, accurate temperature readings. The Laser dot enables instantaneous readings from a few feet away. I regularly check my units with this device. There are limitless applications for this unit. It can be used in laboratories, automotive, even restaurant situations. Worth the money for dependable Fluke over cheap units.
customer_reviews.author: Barry

customer_reviews.title: Fluke IR thermometer
customer_reviews.text: This is the real deal . Do not buy a knock off to save money . You will be sorry if you care about accuracy . Dust water splash resistant 3 meter drop tested . A real winner if you want the best . Hightly Recommended .
customer_reviews.author: Glenn Robert

customer_reviews.title: What an AWESOME TOOL!
customer_reviews.text: This is the easiest tool in the world to use, just point and click!! I thought it might be a little bit harder to figure out but it was so simple. I ordered on the 23rd thru my Prime and received on Christmas Eve! How great is that???!!!!!! Be sure to get the Fluke C115 Polyester Soft Carrying Case so that you can protect you tool because it doesn't come with any.
customer_reviews.author: Lori Ruhl

customer_reviews.title: For what I am using this for, its almost ...
customer_reviews.text: For what I am using this for, its almost over kill but if you want to know the real temperature of something. This will damn sure do it. If you needed this for the automotive industry, its dead on.
customer_reviews.author: Helmar

customer_reviews.title: Useful for measuring heat leaks in home insulation, tire temperature profiles on sports cars, in cooking and many other places.
customer_reviews.text: This is a highly durable, industrial grade product for daily, repeated, field use. The interface could not be easier to use, as it is quite literally point and shoot. The twin lasers are very helpful in understanding the area which is truly being measured. Emissivity of bright surfaces can be a source of a bad reading. The emissivity of the target is settable without fuss or undue effort.
customer_reviews.author: Maneki Neko

customer_reviews.title: Great tool!
customer_reviews.text: We love it, it’s great for hubby to use as a tool and when we are hanging at our bar, we all start using to test heat on each others heads, drinks, the kegerator, amazing and very entertaining!
customer_reviews.author: kerry

customer_reviews.title: This is a great tool for someone that needs a non contact thermometer
customer_reviews.text: This is a great tool for someone that needs a non contact thermometer. Worth the extra cost over the cheapies like harbor freight. Fluke is a quality brand.
customer_reviews.author: Brian

customer_reviews.title: Small. Fast. Light. Sturdy.
customer_reviews.text: Purchased to replace a lost 62 Mini. Simple, intuitive UI. Emissivity set to 0.75 when shooting All-Clad D5 (calibrated against the cast iron grate of a Thermador range at 0.95). 12:1 resolution is adequate for general household use.
customer_reviews.author: Yu Cho

customer_reviews.title: Excellent IR Thermometer for industrial plant use
customer_reviews.text: Excellent IR Thermometer for industrial plant use, decent money too. I use it for steam, cooling and mechanical systems. The dual lasers are what really makes this IR gun, adjustable emissivity is a plus also. I use it around the house and shop also.
customer_reviews.author: Fasted58

customer_reviews.title: Easy to use
customer_reviews.text: A tool with many uses . I first used it to test the temperature of all my calipers on my RV i thought one was hanging up and from there i couldn't stop checking everything else i was addicted. It worked very good on everything.
customer_reviews.author: Dennis Didit

product_meta.title: Fluke 62 Max Plus IR Thermometer, Non Contact, -20 to +1202 Degree F Range - 62 Max Plus
product_meta.description: Style:62 MAX PlusIP54 rated for water and dust resistance. Features. Withstands a 9.8 foot drop Test. temperature range 62 Max 22 to 932 Max 22 to 1202. adjustable emissivity. Hi and low alarms. dimension 6.8 x 3.3 x 2.9 in.
feature_bullets: Infrared thermometer for non-contact surface temperature measurement for use in monitoring electrical, mechanical, HVAC, and automotive systems
Measures temperature from 30 to 650 degrees C ( 22 to 1202 degrees F) with an accuracy of + or 1 degree C or + or 1.0 percent of the reading from 0 to 650 degrees C
Dual lasers rotate to pinpoint the edges of the measurement area
Displays the minimum, the maximum, the difference between the two temperatures, and the average temperatures
Certified IP54 for protection against dust and splashing liquid
IP54 rated for dust and water resistance
Small and lightweight making it easy to clip to your tool belt or belt loop
Precise laser technology makes for more accurate and repeatable measurements
Large Backlit display makes it easier to read data, even in dark areas
Dual rotating lasers to help you identify area to be measured

Average customer reviews has a small extra line on hover* https://omni-grok.amazon.com/xref/src/appgroup/websiteTemplates/retail/SoftlinesDetailPageAssets/udp-intl-lock/src/legacy.css?indexName=WebsiteTemplates#40*/.noUnderline a:hover {text-decoration: none;}
